title: vhdl_ls language server configuration
description: Configuration schema for vhdl_ls, the VHDL language server. Defines libraries, linting rules, and code formatting preferences.

preferred_case.description:
The preferred letter case for code completions and suggestions (e.g., lower, upper_snake, pascal)
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#preferred_case

standard.description:
The VHDL standard version for analysis and linting. Supports short (e.g., '08') and full (e.g., '2008') notation
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#standard

libraries.description:
Defines VHDL libraries in the project. Each library name (except 'work') maps to an object specifying source files
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#libraries

^(?!work$).+$.description: A VHDL library definition. Library names must not be 'work' (reserved by VHDL spec).

files.description:
Array of source file paths or glob patterns belonging to this library. Either absolute or relative to vhdl_ls.toml
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#files

items.description: A file path or glob pattern (e.g., 'src/**/*.vhd', 'lib/ieee.vhd').

exclude.description:
Array of source file paths or glob patterns to exclude from this library
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#exclude

items.description: A file path or glob pattern to exclude (e.g., 'legacy/*', 'src/*_old.vhd').

is_third_party.description:
Whether this library is third-party. May affect diagnostic reporting. Defaults to false
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#is_third_party

lint.description:
Configures linting rules. Each key is a rule name, and the value controls its behavior (true/false to enable/disable, or a string for specific severity)
https://github.com/VHDL-LS/rust_hdl/wiki/VHDL%E2%80%90LS-Configuration#lint

^.+$.description: Lint rule configuration. Can be a boolean (enable/disable) or a string (e.g., 'warning', 'error').
